column1: I joined @SenJoniErnst to urge the @DeptofDefense to test all servicemembers and their families for COVID-19 in order to contain outbreaks in the military and limit the threat to national security. https://t.co/DZH1Q1iWWX
Great news! This $590 million investment will allow ApiJect to build out infrastructure in North Carolina to help in the fight against COVID-19. https://t.co/X7leLKZE1H
Great news for North Carolina. I'm pleased to see another medical technology firm choose North Carolina in the fight to defeat COVID. https://t.co/cc9LrPQ80H

For those who have recovered from COVID-19 like me I would encourage you to join me to defeat this virus. I’m proud to be enrolled in two antibody studies and am scheduled to donate plasma to help however I can to save lives and end COVID-19.  https://t.co/8i1IGQZOCy

Last week I completed my 70th telephone town hall to keep North Carolinians updated on the federal government’s response to COVID-19.   Read my latest newsletter for updates on our fight against COVID-19 and ways you can help defeat this virus. https://t.co/8i1IGRhpu6

I took a moment during the @senjudiciary hearing to encourage others who have recovered from COVID to join me to defeat this virus. I'm proud to be enrolled in two antibody studies and scheduled to donate plasma and hope you'll consider doing your part to end COVID. https://t.co/XvMW3HlEyv

As we all know COVID-19 is a very contagious and deadly virus and I am proud to enroll in the antibody research study through @AtriumHealth and @wakehealth and volunteer to participate in @UNC Chapel Hill’s immunology study and help however I can to end COVID.

I want to thank my doctors who provided guidance throughout my quarantine since testing positive for COVID-19. I feel very fortunate that I had a mild case with few symptoms and I want to thank North Carolinians for their prayers and well-wishes. https://t.co/YiApznLuJI

Thank you @FEMA for awarding @CLTgov a $1.6 million grant to cover costs for taking Emergency Protective Measures to combat COVID-19 including training for response and providing supplies and commodities to hospitals first responders and other critical employees staff.

Since work began to find a COVID-19 vaccine hackers affiliated with foreign nations have worked to steal research from American companies and research institutions. I joined @MarshaBlackburn to introduce legislation to protect U.S. research from hackers. https://t.co/FS4mAVOBoH

Tonight my COVID-19 test came back positive. I’m following the recommendations of my doctor. Thankfully I have no symptoms and feel well. COVID is a very contagious virus. If you were exposed or start to display symptoms please call your doctor self-isolate and get tested. https://t.co/fwc826dkvQ

I joined @SenatorShaheen to introduce the Emergency Support for Rural Water Systems Act to provide rural communities under financial strain caused by the COVID pandemic emergency assistance to repair modernize and renovate failing water infrastructure. https://t.co/2bt45auDSl

Proud to support the CARES Act that included over $19.8 million in federal funding to support organizations like @NCYMCAAlliance who are offering remote learning support sites to provide a safe and healthy place for children to learn during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/hUGHofsi95

I applaud @SenateCommerce on passing the bipartisan RISE Act that would provide $26B to U.S. researchers impacted by the COVID pandemic. I'll continue working to pass this bill to support our world-class researchers scientists institutions & labs in N.C. https://t.co/zGQrdNJyU3

Read the latest update on legislation I introduced this week the America First Vaccine Act that will ensure Americans will be the first to receive any COVID-19 vaccine that was developed by an American company with the support of U.S. taxpayer dollars.  https://t.co/dP9QwGQ56E

America is facing one of its greatest challenges with COVID-19 but we can't lose sight of the opioid epidemic that continues to ravage our nation. Proud to lead the effort to urge the DEA to keep the opioid epidemic a priority in the midst of the pandemic. https://t.co/RHsCUWdhr2 https://t.co/VqvsCFJRyX

Proud to announce @fema is awarding North Carolina a $119 million grant to provide financial assistance to those who have lost wages due to COVID-19 allowing the state to provide an extra $300/week on top of regular unemployment benefits. https://t.co/6HtFaM9rTQ

North Carolina’s housing authorities have been severely affected by the coronavirus pandemic and continue to be in dire need of assistance. @HUDgov's $49.9 million grant provides crucial relief to maintain services and support North Carolinians in need. https://t.co/mYkFVGTtrQ

Today I introduced the America First Vaccine Act legislation that will ensure that Americans will be the first to receive any COVID-19 vaccine that was developed by an American company with the support of U.S. taxpayer dollars. https://t.co/lEJRxD00q9

Read the latest update on how I'm working to support North Carolina’s medical institutions as they drive innovation to increase and improve COVID testing by promoting public/private partnerships. https://t.co/2ozf3hq3mH

The shift to remote learning due to COVID-19 has caused uncertainty for kids who rely on school nutrition programs. I applaud @SecretarySonny & @USDA for providing flexibility to schools to ensure we can provide meals to students in need. https://t.co/6JAibemQdF

When the COVID-19 pandemic began in the United States many Americans noticed that prices on necessary everyday items shot up. Learn more about my work to hold price gougers accountable and protect North Carolinians. https://t.co/pFChEiCqqm

Proud to announce @fema is awarding the State of North Carolina a supplemental grant of $52.8 million to provide financial assistance to North Carolinians who are hurting the most and have lost wages due to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/s2jE46n4LX

Read the latest update on my work to lead the bipartisan push for more funding for COVID-19 medical research and making sure the vaccine is accessible to everyone including Medicare beneficiaries. https://t.co/Gprt3ebFce
I joined a bipartisan group of Senators to urge Senate leadership to renew the push for inclusion of aid for charitable nonprofits in upcoming coronavirus relief legislation.  https://t.co/FPPdlFQgXQ

As the school year begins and challenges brought on by COVID persist I joined my colleagues to urge @USDA @SecretarySonny to continue providing flexibility to schools and sponsoring organizations for school meals and child nutrition.  https://t.co/uUJrWUEfhk

I'm proud to work with my colleagues across the aisle to get the Safeguarding America’s First Responders Act signed into law to ensure family members of every first responder lost to coronavirus has quick access to the benefits they deserve. https://t.co/EU8I9z7CMJ

I joined my colleagues to urge @JBarsaUSAID to protect American taxpayer dollars during the coronavirus pandemic from funding pro-abortion lobbying or advocacy efforts in other countries via the UN in violation of the Siljander Amendment. https://t.co/3w5JVNUWs3

This week I co-sponsored bipartisan legislation to provide states with more resources to increase testing provide faster results and allow states to enter into interstate compacts to maximize efforts to eliminate the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/QQQWDo6gPL

As we continue our fight against COVID-19 I’ve been leading the bipartisan push for more funding for hospitals and medical research. #COVID19NC  Read my latest newsletter on how I'm supporting North Carolina's hospitals and medical research & development. https://t.co/0Qn70oeF8h

I support a temporary extension of the $600 federal supplement to unemployment to give negotiators more time to reach a compromise on COVID legislation. Disgraceful that Chuck Schumer objected to extending benefits in order to play partisan politics & push far-left priorities.

During today's @senjudiciary hearing I pushed my colleagues to support the Civil Justice for Victims of COVID Act legislation I co-introduced that allows Americans to sue China in federal court for its role in causing the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/QK4ImFfoba

This week I released a plan of action that offers solutions to protect the health and well-being of North Carolinians defeat #COVID19 and help us return safely to our normal lives.  Read my full plan ⬇️ https://t.co/JpsnS7tq8F https://t.co/Dd6aH09Cae

My op-ed via @fayobserver on my plan of action to protect the health and well-being of North Carolinians defeat COVID-19 and help us return safely to our normal lives. #COVID19NC  https://t.co/hzwS6eb0mg

Today I released a plan of action to advance COVID-19 testing boost PPE production and protect the jobs and livelihoods of North Carolinians. #COVID19NC   Read the full plan ⬇️ https://t.co/JpsnS7tq8F

I co-sponsored bipartisan legislation to provide assistance for child care providers so they can continue to offer critical affordable services for working parents during COVID-19. #COVID19NC  https://t.co/Ayx3UFojqX
I joined my colleagues to urge Senate leaders to consider policies that will bolster jobs and innovation across the clean energy economy in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/zLIk5jlodN

Today I released a plan of action that offers solutions to protect the health and well-being of North Carolinians defeat #COVID19 and help us return safely to our normal lives.  Read my full plan ⬇️ https://t.co/axf2FV0NkS

I joined @SenGillibrand to urge Senate leaders to include robust funding and programmatic reforms for the Economic Development Admin and its vital grant programs namely the Economic Adjustment Assistance Program in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/6Vmr0JVcok
This week I pushed for #cybersecurity funding in the next relief package to protect #COVID19 vaccine research and stop hackers affiliated with China Russia and Iran. https://t.co/ynD6V42PW0

The House passed bipartisan legislation I co-sponsored to provide additional legal protections for military families impacted by COVID-19. I applaud the House’s passage and look forward to the President signing it into law. https://t.co/6U05eIwhaO

I’m proud to join my colleagues in introducing the Civil Justice for Victims of COVID-19 Act to allow Americans to sue China in federal court for its role in causing the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/QxqyCJ1Ur7

I joined @SenBlumenthal to push for #cybersecurity funding in the next relief package to protect #COVID19 vaccine research and stop hackers affiliated with China Russia and Iran who have attempted to steal American intellectual property. https://t.co/yBPd3cIhuY

Senator @MarkWarner and I recently led a group of bipartisan Senators urging Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and Minority Leader Chuck Schumer to include the cotton and textile industry in the next round of #COVID19 assistance. https://t.co/I7bgBoiH5Z
TODAY at 4:00 pm Telephone Town Hall Topic: #COVID19NC  Listen Live: https://t.co/EjMmqN1Q7U https://t.co/DmDahu3c9P

COVID-19 devastated small and mid-sized businesses across the country. I am proud to co-sponsor the RESTART Act to give them the flexibility they need to utilize their #PaycheckProtectionProgram loans and create a program to jump start these businesses. https://t.co/Xxqjhvatk7
I introduced bipartisan legislation with @SenatorSinema to ensure family members of #veterans who passed away due to the coronavirus receive their dependent benefits.  https://t.co/Atkm1Bw74F

.@wakehealth is on the cutting edge of innovation in the fight against #COVID19 and it was an honor to work with the university to secure federal support for antibody and surveillance research a key component of controlling and defeating the pandemic. https://t.co/ZBVFmBRU3E

As our nation fights against #COVID19 pork producers and poultry farmers continue to deal with supply chain disruptions and backlogs. The RELIEF Act will provide much-needed resources to offset losses related to COVID-19 and continue feeding our nation. https://t.co/CtSAaDM4Ia

Do your part to save lives and slow the spread of #COVID19. Wear a mask. 😷 Social Distance. Stay home if you're not feeling well.   Visit https://t.co/iM5ENxtzDD for steps to care for yourself and how to protect others. https://t.co/RtfMPsIiFh

The Chinese government lied to the world about #COVID19. We’re learning more about China’s cover-up including failure to report the spread of the virus to the WHO. My plan of action to hold China accountable and protect the health and security of America. https://t.co/JPAAHdRowR https://t.co/BIKrYBFhz2

My op-ed in the @salisburypost about hosting 50 #COVID19NC telephone town halls.  "As more of our economy begins to re-open we should all still be diligent in wearing a mask in public and social distancing whenever possible." https://t.co/VkHv2Ok53E

Listening and talking directly with North Carolinians has provided me with invaluable feedback and I’m convinced that the vast majority of North Carolinians are doing their part to prevent the spread of COVID-19. My op-ed via @salisburypost. #COVID19NC https://t.co/VkHv2Ok53E

I introduced The American Citizen Coronavirus Relief Act legislation to amend the CARES Act and ensure U.S. citizens will not be denied federal coronavirus assistance because they're married to a foreign national who is not currently a U.S. citizen. https://t.co/I4k57ORUTo

I joined my colleagues to urge Senate leadership to continue supporting Historically Black Colleges and Universities and Minority Serving Institutions as Congress discusses additional coronavirus relief. #HBCU #COVID19NC  https://t.co/18e8ME1Uhs

“If we see too many cases reported I’m concerned that we could see stay-at-home orders...which is the last thing I want for our economy. Our economic health and our physical health are tightly linked.” via @Courier_Tribune #COVID19NC https://t.co/NOXBIGuMHG

This week I hosted my 50th telephone town hall. These calls give me the opportunity to hear the concerns of North Carolinians and answer questions about #COVID19 and how I'm working to get our economy back on track. https://t.co/jCi7X6kgy6

At today's @senjudiciary hearing I asked @TheJusticeDept and @FBI what they're doing to stop counterfeit PPE COVID testing kits and medicines from #China from reaching Americans. These counterfeit products from China are a threat to public safety. https://t.co/kofd54u5Bf
I joined 15 of my colleagues urging @SecAzar and @SeemaCMS to act swiftly to distribute emergency #COVID19 funds to hospitals serving low-income vulnerable populations. https://t.co/erBiilZTvX
